exclusion:
1. Press MENU on the 524 Control.
  2. Press NEXT to scroll to Z-WAVE screen then press SELECT.
  3. Press YES to exclude the control
inclusion:
1. Press MENU on the 524 Control.
  2. Press NEXT to advance to the Z-WAVE menu.
  3. Press SELECT
label: Trane XR524
overview:
The Trane 524 Touchscreen Comfort Control is compatible with single and multistage forced air systems, including:

  • Gas furnace systems
  • Oil furnace systems
  • Electric furnace systems
  • Heat pump systems
  • Air conditioning systems

parameters.label: Minimum Off Time
parameters.overview: Sets the minimum off time before another heating/cooling cycle can begin to provide compressor short cycle protection. The thermostat screen will display WAIT when minimum off time is being enforced.

parameters.label: Minimum Run Time
parameters.overview: Sets the minimum run time before a heating/cooling cycle can turn off to prevent rapid cycling. Thermostat screen will display "Cool ON" or "Heat ON" while the minimum run time is being enforced.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 1 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating starts.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating stops. Stage 1 turns off at setpoint minus (-) Delta Stage 1.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 2 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating starts.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating stops. Stage 1 turns off at setpoint minus (-) Delta Stage 2.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 3 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating starts.

parameters.label: Heating Delta Stage 3 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating stops. Stage 1 turns off at setpoint minus (-) Delta Stage 3

parameters.label: Cooling Delta Stage 1 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling starts.

parameters.label: Cooling Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling stops. Stage 1 turns off at setpoint minus (-) Delta Stage 1.

parameters.label: Cooling Delta Stage 2 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling starts.

parameters.label: Cooling Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling stops. Stage 1 turns off at setpoint minus (-) Delta Stage 2.

parameters.label: H/C Delta
parameters.overview:
Sets the minimum separation between the heating and cooling setpoints. Attempts to lower the cooling below the heating setpoint by this amount will PUSH the heating setpoint down to maintain this separation. Same for setting the heating setpoint above the cooling setpoint, it will PUSH the cooling setpoint up to maintain this separation.
Settings in F.

parameters.label: SetBack Mode
parameters.overview: 0 = No Setback, 1 = Setback, 2 if ESM

parameters.label: ESM Setpoint--Heating
parameters.overview:
Energy Saving Mode (ESM) Setpoints are the setpoints used when the Energy Saving Mode schedule is selected in the Schedule Mode screen (or via Z-Wave control).
Setting in F.

parameters.label: ESM Setpoint--Cooling
parameters.overview: Energy Saving Mode (ESM) Setpoints are the setpoints used when the Energy Saving Mode schedule is selected in the Schedule Mode screen (or via Z-Wave control).

parameters.label: Fan ON Time
parameters.overview:
The fan cycler function cycles the HVAC system fan for an ON period followed by an OFF period continuously. Used to provide minimum air ventilation requirements.

When the Fan ON time is set to a value greater than 0, an additional Cycler Fan mode is present when pressing the FAN button on the thermostat.

parameters.label: Fan OFF Time
parameters.overview:
The fan cycler function cycles the HVAC system fan for an ON period followed by an OFF period continuously. Used to provide minimum air ventilation requirements.

When the Fan ON time is set to a value greater than 0, an additional Cycler Fan mode is present when pressing the FAN button on the thermostat.

parameters.label: Run Schedule
parameters.overview: Set to 1 if running schedule (RUN is displayed on the thermostat screen).

parameters.label: Backlight Timeout
parameters.overview:
Backlight Timeout is the time (in seconds) from the last button press to the backlight going out. 

The time-out can be set between 0 and 120 seconds. 

When set to 0, the backlight will remain always on.

parameters.label: Screen Timeout
parameters.overview:
This is the time before any screen reverts to the Minimized Screen (temperature display only), after you stop pushing buttons. 

Minimized Screen feature is disabled by setting this time to 0

parameters.label: Sensor (Internal) Offset
parameters.overview: The internal temperature sensor can be calibrated to report values different from its actual reading.  The offset can range from -7 degrees to +7 degrees.

parameters.label: Screen Contrast
parameters.overview:
The Screen Contrast sets the contrast level of the LCD display.

The contrast can be set between 0 and 20.  If the display is too light, use a higher number.  If dark lines appear on the screen, use a lower number

parameters.label: Schedule Enable
parameters.overview: When enabled (set to 1), the local thermostat's scheduler function is enabled.

parameters.label: Schedule Sun-1
parameters.overview:
This value holds information about the first schedule setpoints for Sundays.

  • Byte 1: Hour   (0-23)
  • Byte 2: Minute (0-59)
  •  Byte 3: Heat Setpoint (degrees)
  • Byte 4: Cool Setpoint (degrees)

Default:  0x06004643 06:00AM 70F / 67F

      0x06001519 06:00AM 21C / 25C

parameters.label: Schedule Sun-2
parameters.overview:
This value holds information about the second schedule setpoints for Sundays.

  • Byte 1: Hour   (0-23)
  • Byte 2: Minute (0-59)
  • Byte 3: Heat Setpoint (degrees)
  • Byte 4: Cool Setpoint (degrees)

Default:  0x08003e55 08:00AM 62F / 85F

      0x0800101d 08:00AM 16C / 29C

parameters.label: Schedule Sun-3
parameters.overview:
This value holds information about the third schedule setpoints for Sundays.

  • Byte 1: Hour   (0-23)
  • Byte 2: Minute (0-59)
  • Byte 3: Heat Setpoint (degrees)
  • Byte 4: Cool Setpoint (degrees)

Default:  0x1200464e 06:00PM 70F / 78F

      0x12001519 06:00PM 21C / 25C

parameters.label: Schedule Sun-4
parameters.overview:
This value holds information about the fourth schedule setpoints for Sundays.

  • Byte 1: Hour   (0-23)
  • Byte 2: Minute (0-59)
  • Byte 3: Heat Setpoint (degrees)
  • Byte 4: Cool Setpoint (degrees)

Default:  0x16003e52 10:00PM 62F / 82F

      0x1600101b 10:00PM 16C / 27C
